title: UC Davis-Mercer game declared no contest after weather delay in fourth quarter
description: UC Davis was leading 23-17 with 7:46 left until rain and lightning sent the game into a delay. It was eventually called off.
content:
The Football Championship Subdivision opening kickoff game between UC Davis and Mercer ended in a rare no contest, after torrential rain and unending lightning sent the game into a delay late in the fourth quarter. With no end in sight in the forecast, the remainder of the game was called off.

No. 7 UC Davis was leading No. 11 Mercer 23-17 with 7:46 left and Mercer possessing the ball at midfield. The neutral-site game took place in Montgomery, Ala., and the game’s statistics were voided.

Mercer trailed 23-3 in the third quarter, before rallying to pull within six points in the fourth.

Canceling ongoing college football games due to weather is rare. Last year, a Division II game between Clark Atlanta and Florida Memorial ended in a tie at halftime due to weather. That went in the record books as an even rarer tie.

keywords.name: The Football Championship Subdivision opening kickoff game

summary: The Football Championship Subdivision opening game between UC Davis and Mercer ended in a no contest due to torrential rain and unending lightning. The game was called off due to no end to the forecast. The decision was made after the game was deemed inconvitable. The match took place in Montgomery, Alabama.
shortSummary: The opening ceremony of the season ended in a 0.6% loss after torrential rain, resulting in a 3.4% loss for both sides.
